title: Millie Bobby Brown really wasn't a fan of Eleven's Stranger Things season 3 end
text:
Millie Bobby Brown wasn’t into Eleven’s end game in Stranger Things season 3 (Netflix)

Stranger Things 3 may have been the triumph to heal the wounds from the Game of Thrones finale this year but Millie Bobby Brown was ‘p****d’ with Eleven’s cliff-hanger.

The Netflix series has now been confirmed for a season four, following on from Jim Hopper’s (played by David Harbour) sacrifice which meant his badass daughter moved in with Joyce (Winona Ryder) and the Byers family before they fled Hawkins because no one in their right mind would stay there after battling a slew of monsters which have been harbouring beneath the surface.

But for Millie, the ending just didn’t fly.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I was p****d,’ she told Elle. ‘I read the script and I was like, “What, how is this even possible? Why are they moving away?” They were like “Didn’t you read episode 3?” And I was like, “Oh yeah.” Because Joyce said she wanted to move away from Hawkins.

‘I don’t know, I just felt really against it,’ she continued. ‘When we were filming it, all of us kids said to each other, “So how are we all going to cry?” Because we don’t really cry in front of each other very often. I usually am the one who’s crying in every single scene and the kids have to deal with me listening to [sad] music and they’re like, “Oh God.”

‘I thought, are we all going to go off and listen to music? And then one of the kids was like, “Imagine if we have to do this for real one day.” And we were like, “What do you mean?” And they were like, “What if, when Stranger Things is over, we’ll all have to say goodbye to each other and like this is it.”

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Millie’s pretty hyped for Stranger Things season 4 (Picture: Getty)

‘And we all started crying and then they rolled camera and said action. And that was it. We all started saying goodbye to each other. We felt too real.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The teen entrepreneur, who launched her own production company alongside her sister Paige Brown last year, also revealed the Stranger Things 4 fan theory which has really ‘freaked [her] out’.

As for what’s in store, she still has no idea. And it seems David Harbour is just as much in the dark as you or us as he called producers Ross and Matthew Duffer to ask: ‘Is Hopper dead?’

Their response? ‘We’re still figuring it out.’ Great.

One Stranger Things fan, however, may have discovered Hopper’s whereabouts even if the actual Duffer Brothers haven’t quite got there yet.

Stranger Things seasons one to three are available to stream on Netflix.
